item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Let us accept truth, even when it surprises us and alters our views." -- George Sand

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "It was love at first sight, at last sight, at ever and ever sight." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by François de La Rochefoucauld
item.description: "No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong." -- François de La Rochefoucauld

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "Punctuality is the virtue of the bored." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint, or even remember it. It is enough." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Aaron Copland
item.description: "To stop the flow of music would be like the stopping of time itself, incredible and inconceivable." -- Aaron Copland

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Deanna Raybourn
item.description: "Fate is by far the greatest mystery of all." -- Deanna Raybourn

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Aphra Behn
item.description: "That perfect tranquility of life, which is nowhere to be found but in retreat, a faithful friend and a good library." -- Aphra Behn

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Tamora Pierce
item.description: "Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary." -- Tamora Pierce

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Hope Smiles from the threshold of the year to come, Whispering 'it will be happier'..." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Life is always either a tightrope or a feather bed. Give me the tightrope." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Maybe ever’body in the whole damn world is scared of each other." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Zinha69 add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness." -- George Sand
